name: places/ChIJp3KL0JlZwokR0mXTEbN2NmU
formattedAddress: 15 E 11th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 15 E 11th St, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text:
Apartment has cockroaches!  Even after the exterminator has been called once and I was away for 3 weeks, they are still here.
Do not rent here if you can avoid it.

You would think because a significant number of units in this building are owned by the Simons Foundation that it would be well-managed, but it isn't.  The management company they have hired is pretty low-effort.

The good doorman that the other reviewers are talking about no longer works here as far as I can tell.  Some are great, but most of the doorpeople are completely uninterested in helping residents with problems or finding packages.

Way overpriced for the cheaply remodeled spaces.  The 'studio apartments' are clearly meant to be dorm rooms for students.  You can find better a better deal for a larger studio even in this neighborhood.

Included internet is too slow for video calls.  Apartment didn't seem to be cleaned after previous tenant moved out.  Also, the hot water sometimes goes out for days at a time.

originalText.text: Jesse is really what makes this building so special. He was the first person I met when I started looking into living in this building and the interaction with him was one of the reasons I chose to rent here. He is always professional and has become a real friend to me over the past year. Not only is Jesse great at his job, but he is genuinely just a great person. He truly goes above and beyond. For just one example out of many, one night I was trying to park my car in front of the building, but there was a large snow bank. Jesse came out and offered to help shovel so I could park there. Jesse puts a smile on my face every morning when I come down for my morning coffee and puts me in a good mood even when I am having a hard day. He is truly what makes "the Alabama" THE Alabama!

originalText.text:
The Alabama is a great building.  Jesse the doorman is especially great.  He goes way above and beyond.  He knows every single resident by name, which helps make people feel at home when they step into the building.  Additionally, he frequently helps with things like remembering if you have a package, navigating building dynamics (people being loud, help with landlord, etc), and other important items.

Overall, great building and having Jesse adds a ton to that experience!

originalText.text:
I lived at The Alabama for three years - the people working there such as Grenten, Erion, and Jesse made it a much easier and pleasant experience. Erion, the super, was always available to help. He helped us solve why our dishwasher was always leaking and helped me fix points in my walls where there were some holes. I just moved out and he helped make the whole process a lot easier. He is very quick to answer emails and calls at any time and got along well with the rest of the building staff which made it easier to get information. He and the building manager, Grenten, were very friendly and professional - they always greeted the tenants and were just generally helpful for any issues.

Jesse was a really great doorman - very professional, kind, and ready to help!

originalText.text: I’m a frequent visitor of The Alabama because I go there to study with my friend who lives there. The study rooms and amenities are very nice and the doorman Jesse is super sweet and helpful. He has helped me and my friends find places in the city and always has a smile on his face. The building location is convenient if you want to stay close to NYU and my friend’s apartment is lovely- she has never had any problems. So if you are a college student looking for a great location, I would recommend here.
